title: Grades 9-12: American Sign Language, Advanced Independent Study
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

656F3B21A99343348D0483DF27639C96.description: show evidence of becoming a lifelong learner by using ASL at the advanced proficiency level for personal enrichment and career development.

D54A5813FCBF4E21A706FDB0587E5408.description: use technology to communicate with the Deaf/ASL community; and

83BF05D522EC4CAD95396FD72B092697.description: apply ASL at the advanced proficiency level in or out of the school setting through involvement in cultural activities such as attending Deaf events;

15E76AD181044566AC5C75B6F14E4FA5.description: Communities. The student participates in the Deaf/ASL community by using ASL. The student is expected to:

2D1D964DDDE9491EA8896A653A388FA9.description: apply ASL at the advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of how one language and culture can influence another.

5AF74AB5DF5F4946A5B859AA33B8D674.description: apply ASL at the advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of culture through comparisons of the student's own culture and the American Deaf culture; and

705C1AB31D9E49E3BDC7A96BB0D01220.description: apply ASL at the advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the student's own language and ASL;

E9D8303AFF1B4C21BB525AFEB022BB57.description: Comparisons. The student expands insight into the nature of language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to ASL and American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

2C60BF754B5D473D8A0D1991D2A71EC6.description: apply ASL at the advanced proficiency level to obtain, reinforce, or expand knowledge of other subject areas.

EB1E6A8007724E70BFB4470D64771BC4.description: use resources and digital technology to gain access to extensive information about ASL and Deaf culture; and

0BA0AC79E1F94F23B385BE5C2D6B792E.description: Connections. The student uses ASL to make connections with other subject areas and to acquire information. The student is expected to:

9CBA2B5663F14C81A9DC4DA0C5B3B1D6.description: demonstrate an in-depth understanding of Deaf history and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture.

C0A0ECE43FE045ADAB4D1156AE38C16C.description: apply ASL to show evidence of an in-depth appreciation of the contributions to arts and sciences by the Deaf and how they are applied to the perspectives of American Deaf culture; and

F1F79B24A7954BE5B5C30FF57FA4FBB8.description: apply ASL to show evidence of an in-depth appreciation of ASL literature created by the Deaf and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

669BEB7636E8489BBBC88322941881EB.description: apply ASL to recognize and use Deaf cultural norms to demonstrate an in-depth understanding of the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

77B9E104A2E44493B18766673707A7D9.description: Cultures. The student gains knowledge and understanding of American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

C5DA9100839943069518A9F66A636E73.description: create and express ASL literature, including handshape stories, that follows traditional cultural features.

9E73356FCAEE488888F34FEA0D85D60B.description: demonstrate appropriate usage of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics at the advanced proficiency level; and

C41C431D6DDE44A1BF624073E934A790.description: convey information in ASL using concepts, classifiers, phrases, and sentences to others without voice at the advanced proficiency level;

40B30985CB784FE29780E793778D388F.description: demonstrate an in-depth understanding of ASL such as stories, commands, and instructions when dealing with familiar and unfamiliar topics;

475B42A9F25341E391EC1658EF8B2748.description: engage in a variety of ASL exchanges of learned material to socialize and to provide and obtain information at an advanced proficiency level;

4199E3ECB603465FB47E99114A9B8E43.description: Communication. The student communicates in ASL using expressive and receptive communication skills without voice. The student is expected to:

97D5E3B99ECB4F0A84E7164809B8396A.description: American Sign Language, Advanced Independent Study
